citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States
citeinfo.title: Food Stamp Recipients in the United States

pubinfo.publish: National Atlas of the United States

descript.abstract: This map layer shows the estimated number of Supplemental Nutrition Assistance (food stamp) recipients in the United States, by county, for the years 1989, 1993, 1995, 1997-2002, and 2003-2008. It is drawn from United States Department of Agriculture, Food and Nutrition Service (USDA/FNS) information on the number of people participating in the food stamp program. Those data were used in the production of the U.S. Census Bureau's Small Area Income and Poverty estimates. Food stamp recipient estimates are generally for July of the reference year; in a few cases the States were able to provide data only for other reference periods. In 2008, the federal Food Stamps Program was renamed the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP).
descript.purpose: These data are intended for geographic display and analysis at the national level, and for large regional areas. The data should be displayed and analyzed at scales appropriate for 1:2,000,000-scale data. No responsibility is assumed by the National Atlas of the United States, the United States Department of Agriculture, Food and Nutrition Service, or the U.S. Census Bureau in the use of these data.
descript.supplinf:
To create the maps in the National Atlas Map Maker, <http://nationalatlas.gov/mapmaker>, fd8902t.dbf was joined to the county boundaries available from the National Atlas data download page, <http://nationalatlas.gov/atlasftp.html>. The 1989 data were joined to the 1990 county boundaries (co1990p020), the 1993, 1995, and 1997-1999 data were joined to the 2000 county boundaries (co2000p020), and the 2000-2008 data were joined to the 2001 county boundaries (countyp020); the more detailed 2012 county boundaries can also be used with these data.
The Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) is the new name for the federal Food Stamp Program, as of October 1, 2008. Data originally came from the U.S. Census Bureau's Small Area Income and Poverty Estimates web site, <http://www.census.gov/did/www/saipe/data/model/tables.html>.
Information about National Atlas Web Map Services (WMS) is available on the WMS Introduction page at <http://nationalatlas.gov/infodocs/wms_intro.html>.

place.placekt: U.S. Department of Commerce; 1987; Codes for the Identification of the States, the District of Columbia and the Outlying Areas of The United States, and Associated Areas (FIPS 5-2); Washington, DC; National Institute of Standards and Technology.

idinfo.useconst: None. Acknowledgment of the National Atlas of the United States of America; United States Department of Agriculture, Food and Nutrition Service (USDA/FNS); and (or) U.S. Census Bureau would be appreciated in products derived from these data.

dataqual.logic: No checks for logical consistency were performed on this map layer.
dataqual.complete: This map layer includes the number of food stamp recipients for 1989, 1993, 1995, and 1997-2008 by county in the United States, including the District of Columbia.

citeinfo.origin: United States Department of Agriculture, Food and Nutrition Service
citeinfo.title: County Food Stamp Input Data Files
1980 to 1989 Population Estimates of the U.S., States, and Counties
County Population Estimates and Demographic Components of Population Change: Annual Time Series, July 1, 1990 to July 1, 1999
Population, Population change and estimated components of population change: April 1, 2000 to July 1, 2004

citeinfo.origin: United States Department of Agriculture, Food and Nutrition Service
citeinfo.title: County SNAP benefits data
Annual Estimates of the Resident Population for Counties, April 1, 2000 to July 1, 2008

procstep.procdesc: The Food Stamp data for 1989, 1993, 1995, and 1997-2002 were downloaded in Excel format. A row containing header information was added, and the file was loaded into ArcView and saved as a dBASE IV file. The three files containing population estimates were downloaded, loaded into ArcView, and saved as dBASE files. The population estimate files were joined to the food stamp file. Fields were added to contain the percentage of food stamp recipients for each year. The values for the new fields were calculated by dividing the appropriate population estimate into the number of food stamp recipients and multiplying by 100. Fields that were blank were given values of -9999 or -9.0. A record was added for Yellowstone National Park (FIPS 30113). Records for individual States were deleted.

The SNAP data for 2003-2008 were downloaded in Excel format. The files containing the population estimates were also downloaded in Excel format. The population estimate files were joined to the SNAP file. Fields to contain the percentage of food stamp recipients were added. The values for the new fields were calculated by dividing the appropriate population estimate into the number of food stamp recipients and multiplying by 100. Fields that were blank were given values of -9999 or -9.0. Records for individual States were deleted. The Excel file was joined to the Food_89_02 dBase file and saved as Food_89_08.

enttyp.enttypl: Food Stamp recipient estimates (described by fd8908t.dbf)
enttyp.enttypd: Estimates of the number of food stamp recipients, by county in the United States. The data are for 1989, 1993, 1995, and 1997-2008.
